pages.md:
# F-Log/HLG RECORDING

Choose the destination for F-Log and HLG (Hybrid Log-Gamma) movies shot while the camera is connected to an HDMI device.

| Option          | Description                                                                 |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| !Film Simulation | The footage is processed using film simulation and both saved to the memory card and output to the HDMI device. |
| !F-Log           | The footage is recorded to the memory card and output to the HDMI device in F-Log format. |
| !FLog2           | The footage is recorded to the memory card and output to the HDMI device in F-Log2 format. |
| !HLG             | The footage is recorded to the memory card and output to the HDMI device in HLG format. |

> ðŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - **F-Log** and **FLog2** offer gentle gamma curves with wide gamuts suitable for further processing post-production. Sensitivity is restricted to values between ISO 500 and ISO 12800 (**F-Log**) or between ISO 1000 and ISO 12800 (**FLog2**).
> - The **HLG** (Hybrid Log-Gamma) recording format conforms to the international ITU-R BT2100 standard. When viewed on HLG-compatible displays, high-quality HLG footage faithfully captures high-contrast scenes and vivid colors. Sensitivity is restricted to values between ISO 800 and ISO 12800.
> - Film simulation !Film Simulation footage is recorded using the option selected for !Image Quality Setting **IMAGE QUALITY SETTING** > !Film Simulation **FILM SIMULATION** in the shooting menu.
